conclusion: To determine if Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), analyze the slopes of their velocity-time graphs.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, represented by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Object A's velocity-time graph is represented by the curve labeled 'A'.
Object B's velocity-time graph is represented by the curve labeled 'B'.
Find the point on the horizontal axis corresponding to \( t_1 \).
For Object A, draw a tangent to the curve at \( t_1 \) and determine its slope.
For Object B, draw a tangent to the curve at \( t_1 \) and determine its slope.
If the slopes of the tangents at \( t_1 \) for both objects are equal, then their accelerations at \( t_1 \) are the same.
If the slopes are different, then their accelerations at \( t_1 \) are different.
At \( t_1 \), the slope of the tangent to Object A's curve appears to be negative.
At \( t_1 \), the slope of the tangent to Object B's curve appears to be positive.
Since the slopes of the tangents to the velocity-time graphs of Object A and Object B at \( t_1 \) are different, the accelerations of the two objects at \( t_1 \) are not the same.
No, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
